results.title: Hidden universe: the brain. Part 2
results.creator_credit: Tom Bywaters, American Broadcasting Company and CRM/McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Discusses the cause of aphasia and shows experiments with infants which test their cognitive development and general learning patterns. Also includes a study of visial perception and the advances being made toward giving sight to the blind, as well as looking at a variety of brain malfunctions and current treatment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tom Bywaters, American Broadcasting Company and CRM/McGraw-Hill Films

results.title: Hidden universe: the brain. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Tom Bywaters, American Broadcasting Company and CRM/McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the functions of the brain, including motor control, memory and sensory perceptions. Shows doctors performing a craniotomy, probing different parts of the brain, and indicating the sensations that this causes. Discusses the separate functions of the left and right sides of the brain.

results.title: Growth model
results.brief_description: Presents views on limits to growth, including the availability of space, decreasing stores of natural resources and reduced effectiveness of social institutions. Also offers a scenario of the life of a young couple living in a growing society which lacks stabilising mechanisms.

results.title: Projections for the future: a behavior model
results.brief_description: Discusses the use and misuse of operant conditioning as a social organizer. Also depicts one social system that might result from the application of operant conditioning methods. Suitable for upper secondary and teacher/tertiary levels.

results.title: Beauty knows no pain
results.creator_credit: Elliott Erwitt and Elliott Erwitt Enterprises
results.brief_description: Illustrates behind the scenes story of how Kilgore College in Texas creates the nationally known drill team, The Rangerettes, which smiles its way through the half-time interval at college football games. Useful as a study of group dynamics, mass hysteria and the 1960s - 70s stereotyped view of the female image. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Yevtushenko: a poet's journey
results.creator_credit: Harold Mantell and Films for the Humanities
results.brief_description: On a tour of the US and at home in his Moscow appartment, Russian poet Yevgeny Yevtushenko struggles with the responsibilities traditionally contigent on his country’s writers; custodians of the public conscience and witnesses to the naked tragedy of life in a hostile physical environement and under a succession of autocratic regimes. Yevtushenko is both the gentle melancholy writer and the powerful and charismatic poet-performer; the film captures this duality in his impassioned readings of the poems ‘Babi Yar’, ‘Prologue’ and ‘Bratski Station’. A hauntingly beautiful portrait of this fine Russian poet.

results.title: E E Cummings: the making of a poet
results.brief_description: Traces the poetic growth of E. E. Cummings, using his own voice, poetry paintings, drwaings and notebooks. Poems included are: ‘Thank You God For Most This Amazing’, ‘If There Are Any Heavens My Mother’, ‘In Just Spring’, ‘Life Is More True Than Reason Will Deceive’, ‘Paris’, “The April Sunset Completely Utters’, ‘Carry Your Heart With Me’ and others. The narration is adapted from ‘Six Nonlectures’ by E. E. Cummings recorded at Havard University.

results.title: Sophocles: Oedipus the King
results.brief_description: An Abridged version of Sophocles’ play performed in the 5th century BC amphitheatre at Amphiaralon by the Athens Classical Theatre Company styled on the ancient models. Narrated by Anthony Quayle, it features James Mason as Oedipus, Claire Bloom as Jocasta and Ian Richardson as Tiresias.
